intro: Chaunochiton breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body covered in a layer of mucus. The plant has a distinctive, elongated shape with a broad, flattened body and a pair of elongated tentacles. Its reproductive structures include small, short-flowered gynostomes that are adapted for external fertilization. The species plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various marine organisms.
